alert.note: Alert for Victoria (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 8:54PM CDT until May 18 at 3:24PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Texas... Guadalupe River at Victoria affecting Victoria County. For the Guadalupe River...including Victoria...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Guadalupe River at Victoria. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 28.5 feet, moderate lowland flooding occurs. Water flows over the road at Red River and Bluff Intersection. Water may be flowing over the intersection of Craig and Constitution. The access to homes near Club Westerner may be affected. Areas west of Moody Street between Water and Constitution Street may be impacted. Water is at the edge of Spring Creek Drive at the railroad underpass. The old town area may be threatened. The McCright Drive loop behind the baseball stadium may have water covering the road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM CDT Sunday, the stage was 28.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will crest at 28.5 feet late tonight, then begin a slow fall, dropping below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Below are the latest river stages and stage forecasts: Fld Observed Forecasts (10 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Thu Fri Guadalupe River Victoria 21.0 28.2 Sun 8 pm 28.4 28.0 21.8 11.9 9.9 &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/crp.
